thread.title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Government urged against 'clumsy' Brexit plan; plus latest news
thread.title_full: Business Breakfast LIVE: Government urged against 'clumsy' Brexit plan; plus latest news

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Government urged against 'clumsy' Brexit plan; plus latest news
text:
Business Breakfast LIVE: Government urged against 'clumsy' Brexit plan; plus latest news Updated 08:05, 21 Sep 2016 By Kathryn Riddell The Journal Business team's live blog bringing you the morning's most important business and financial news Share Get business news by email Christopher Furlong/Getty Images A European Union flag, with a hole cut in the middle, flies at half-mast outside a home in Knutsford Cheshire after today's historic referendum on June 24, 2016 in Knutsford, United Kingdom 
Good morning and welcome to the Journal Business team's morning live blog for Wednesday, September 21. 
I'm Kathryn Riddell and I'm in the live blog chair this week to bring you regular updates on all the breaking business news from across the North East and beyond. 
The business breakfast live blog covers the latest big stories from the region's business community, as well as national news, FTSE updates and stock exchange announcements from the Journal region's listed companies and national firms - anything and everything from the world of business basically. 
I'll also remind you of some of our latest regional stories in case you missed them. 
If you'd like to contribute tweet at @jnlbusiness to share your opinions, drop me a line at kathryn.riddell@trinitymirror.com Key Events So Far 08:06 Kathryn Riddell 'Don't rush Brexit' 
The Government is being urged not to rush through a “clumsy” Brexit plan amid calls for manufacturers to retain access to the single market. 
Protecting industry will be “critical” in the negotiations to leave the EU and firms must continue to be able to employ workers from other European countries, said the EEF. 
A survey of 2,000 members of the public by the manufacturers’ group found that only 5% believed that damaging the sector was a price worth paying for leaving the EU. 
The EEF urged ministers to “hold their nerve” and work out a plan to help manufacturing companies cope with life outside the EU . 08:00 Kathryn Riddell Morning all 
Good morning and welcome to the Journal Business team’s morning live blog for Wednesday, September 21. 
I’m Kathryn Riddell and I’m in the live blog chair this week to bring you regular updates on all the breaking business news from across the North East and beyond. 
The business breakfast live blog covers the latest big stories from the region’s business community, as well as national news, FTSE updates and stock exchange announcements from the Journal region’s listed companies and national firms - anything and everything from the world of business basically. 
Let’s get started!
